revised_title: Investigation of Thermal Conductivity in Lead at Low Temperatures
tldr: The thermal conductivity of lead at low temperatures was investigated in this study. Measurements were made on a series of lead specimens, including single crystals and polycrystals, with and without added impurities. The results confirmed that below a certain temperature, thermal current is carried entirely by lattice waves and is not scattered by conduction electrons. This discovery has implications for understanding the theory of superconductivity.
